docs.lead_paragraph: It is widely believed that going to a hospital in July is a bad idea because inexperienced interns and residents are just starting their new jobs. But when the belief is tested scientifically, there is little hard evidence for it. A new study presented at a meeting of the American Association of Neurological Surgeons confirms that care in teaching hospitals in July and August is no worse (and no better) than any other time of year.
docs.snippet: It is widely believed that going to a hospital in July is a bad idea because inexperienced interns and residents are just starting their new jobs. But when the belief is tested scientifically, there is little hard evidence for it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Parents would certainly deny it, but Canadian researchers have made a startling assertion: parents take better care of pretty children than they do ugly ones. Researchers at the University of Alberta carefully observed how parents treated their children during trips to the supermarket. They found that physical attractiveness made a big difference.

headline.main: Ugly Children May Get Parental Short Shrift

docs.snippet: Parents would certainly deny it, but Canadian researchers have made a startling assertion: parents take better care of pretty children than they do ugly ones.
